#summary CSV Directory connector

<wiki:toc max_depth="2"/>

= Overview =

The CSV Directory Connector supports provisioning to and from a directory of files in CSV format.

Its typical usage should be bulk-loading.

= Installation =

Follow these steps to run the stand-alone connector server:

 # Download the connector server jar file and store it in the connector server directory (any directory).
 # Download the CSV directory connector jar file and store it in the bundles subdirectory.
 # Start the connector server. For more information, see [ConnectorServers Connector Servers].

=Supported operations=

 *   Create
 *   Delete
 *   Update
 *   Search
 *   Schema
 *   Sync

=Configuration=

==Configuration Properties==

The following table describes all of the properties that you can specify for the configuration:

<table border="1">
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th> Configuration Property </th>
      <th> Type </th>
      <th> Required </th>
      <th> Description </th>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Source Path </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td> X </td>
      <td> Absolute path of a directory where are located CSV files to be processed </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> File Mask </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td> X </td>
      <td> Regular expression describing files to be processed </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> File Encoding </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Basic encoding of the file. </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Field Delimiter </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td> X </td>
      <td> Delimiter used to separate fields in CSV files </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Text qualifier  </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Delimiter to determine begin and end of text in value </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Key column name </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Name of the column used to identify user uniquely </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Password column name  </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Name of the column used to specify user password </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Delete column name  </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Name of the column used to specify users to be deleted </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Value quotation required </td>
      <td> Boolean </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Specify if value quotation is required </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Column names </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Name of the all columns</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Ignore header </td>
      <td> Boolean </td>
      <td></td>
      <td> Specify it first line file must be ignored </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td> Key separator </td>
      <td> String </td>
      <td> X </td>
      <td> Character used to separate keys in a multi-key scenario </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
